glsa.title: ISC DHCP: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A memory exhaustion vulnerability in ISC DHCP could lead to Denial of Service.

background.p: ISC DHCP is a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) client/server.

description.p: ISC DHCP is vulnerable to a memory exhaustion attack involving regular expressions sent by DHCP clients.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request from a malicious or spoofed client, potentially leading to a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All ISC DHCP users should upgrade to the latest version:
